title: Technology Skills Workshop Series
transcript: The Public Library's Digital Literacy Program offers a comprehensive six-week workshop series designed for adults over fifty. Sessions cover essential computer skills including internet navigation, email management, social media basics, and online banking security. Classes are held every Tuesday and Thursday from 2 to 4 PM in the library's computer lab, which accommodates sixteen participants per session. The program is entirely free, funded by a government grant for senior education initiatives. Participants must attend at least five of the six sessions to receive a completion certificate. Registration opens on the first Monday of each month and typically fills within forty-eight hours due to high demand. Additional support is available through one-on-one tutoring sessions scheduled by appointment.
